Scott Dahl - Sage on the stage is out.  Social learning is in.  Interactive, continuous.  #acme2011
Multi-media CME appeals to the three learning types - visual, auditory, kinetic.  Variety engages deeper level learning.  #acme2011
Multi-media CME - Match learning objectives to right media.  As whip &  buggy are to the car, the printed word is to new media.  #acme2011
"Simulated medicine."  43% docs now under 44 and grew up gaming.   98% think games realistic, engaging, useful, effective. #acme2011
Numerous sessions on Faculty Development and Management; what's worked and not.  How to reduce tension, increase productivity.  #acme2011
Trend - multidisciplinary team training - roles of diff clinicians, order of treatment, & working together to improve outcomes. #acme2011
Water cooler talk- Shift away from using CME to using CPD.  Lifelong learning and non-traditional formats.  #acme2011
Great new CME opportunities in Asia, as they conducted their first CME meeting Summer 2010.  Lots of open markets to develop.
In Europe, governments funding CME by providing financial rebates to MD's for disease states Govts feel need better patient outcomes.
No CME in Europe, just CPD = CME + management and social skills.  Debate beginning in US about whether US should be CME or CPD.
Discussion about inclusion of patient advocacy groups in CME.  Important perspective, but need proper role and expectations.  #acme2011
EUMS supports CME with inclusion of pharma funding.  Industry support critical.  Wants unified policies in 27 member states #acme2011

All you East Coasters, get home safely!!  Or, stay here in Sunny California!  :-)
